alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 11:34AM MST until July 31 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 230 PM MST. * At 1129 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laguna Lake, Hualapai Reservation, Fraziers Well, Grand Canyon National Park and Lake Mead National Recreation Area. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chino Wash, Diamond Creek, Albers Wash, Prospect Valley, Hundred and Ninetythree Mile Creek, Colorado River, Sandstone Wash and Mohawk Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
